title: Ummm rng in a pro scene game?
body: am i the only one not ok with rng in a pro scene game? like these dragon could fuck up people pretty hard... i mean fucking hell get something useless for your team and amazing for the losing team 10 times in a row if the enemy team has like a nunu or cho with smite ur fucked... like serously wtf?

replies.body: Your name is literally one crit man, and you are worried about RNG?

Alright I'll give a serious reply now.

RNG is not always a bad thing. Being able to adjust your strategy to the strengths of what is given to you (or your opponent) shows your ability to adapt and capitalize on specific advantages. Also, it provides a lot of variance outside of champ select. Playing in--and spectating--matches should be a lot more interesting now just to see how the game's focus can chage depending on what is given.
